## Part 1 (ch24)

**Mark T (True) or F (False) in each of the following sentences.**

::: {.webex-check .webex-box}

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

cat("1", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Historically, over long horizons, investments in stocks is expected to outperform investments in bonds.", "\n\n")
cat("2", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The expected, or mean, return is the return we expect to earn on average.", "\n\n")
cat("3", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The realized or total return for an investment is the total return of the dividend yield and the capital gain rate.", "\n\n")
cat("4", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The market risk premium is the expected average return of the market portfolio.", "\n\n")
cat("5", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The total risk of a security represents only its systematic risk.", "\n\n")
cat("6", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Because investors can eliminate idiosyncratic risk, they do not require a risk premium for taking it on.", "\n\n")
cat("7", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The market risk premium is the expected average return of the market portfolio.", "\n\n")
cat("8", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The beta of a security is the sensitivity of the security’s return to the return of the overall market.", "\n\n")
cat("9", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Investors typically demand a higher return for investments with higher levels of risk.", "\n\n")
cat("10", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Systematic risk can be diversified away by holding a well-diversified portfolio of assets.", "\n\n")
cat("11", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Standard deviation is a measure of the total risk of an investment.", "\n\n")
cat("12", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Diversification involves spreading investment across different assets to reduce risk.", "\n\n")
cat("13", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Systematic risk is specific to individual assets and can be diversified away by holding a diversified portfolio.", "\n\n")
cat("14", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The risk-return tradeoff suggests that higher returns are associated with higher levels of risk.", "\n\n")
cat("15", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Investors always prefer investments with lower risk, even if it means sacrificing potential returns.", "\n\n")
cat("16", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "In finance, risk refers to the uncertainty that an investment's actual return will differ from its expected return.", "\n\n")
cat("17", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The market risk premium is the expected average return of the market portfolio.", "\n\n")
cat("18", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The market risk premium represents the excess return that investors expect to earn from investing in the market over the risk-free rate.", "\n\n")
cat("19", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The expected, or mean, return is the return we expect to earn on average.", "\n\n")
cat("20", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Systematic risk, also known as market risk, is the risk that is inherent to the entire market or an entire market segment.", "\n\n")
cat("21", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The realized or total return for an investment is the total return of the dividend yield and the capital gain rate.", "\n\n")
cat("22", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Systematic risk cannot be eliminated through diversification because it affects the entire market.", "\n\n")
cat("23", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "Systematic risk is specific to individual assets and can be diversified away by holding a diversified portfolio.", "\n\n")

cat("24", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The following risk is an example of firm-specific risk: The risk that the founder and CEO retires", "\n\n")
cat("25", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The risk that oil prices rise, increasing production costs", "\n\n")
cat("26", fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The risk that a product design is faulty and the product must be recalled", "\n\n")
cat("27", fitb("F", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), "The risk that the economy slows, reducing demand for the firm’s products.", "\n\n")
```
